intro: Memorialis mysorensis, commonly known as the Mysore memorial plant, is a flowering shrub native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and prefers well-drained soil. Its leaves are ovate and have a glossy surface, while its stems are woody and branched. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its therapeutic properties.
